settings.testimonial: Zen Maitri is a true gem…I had a wellness consultation which helped me think through my health and lifestyle, and got great products which I use every day.
settings.author: Michele

settings.testimonial: The vibe here is like a mini oasis... We were given the patience and the time to discuss our health issues & goals.
settings.author: Camilla

settings.testimonial: I have my consultations done over zoom and they fly the products out to me by courier halfway around the world. I have never come across better quality products or care than at Zen Maitri.
settings.author: Cyba

settings.title: Health Consultations
settings.text: Take control of your health.

settings.title: You talk. We listen.
settings.text:
A Zen Maitri Natural Health Consultation gives you the opportunity to explore your health concerns with a Medical Herbalist, who can tailor a prescription to meet your goals.

The expert knowledge provided by our team will empower you to make positive changes to your lifestyle.

settings.title: What does a consultation involve?
settings.text:
Our standard consultation format looks like this:

  • An appointment with a Medical Herbalist to assess of your physical and mental needs
  • Research and formulation of your bespoke natural prescription
  • A check-in to see how things are going with your prescription

settings.title: Choose A Consultation
settings.text_1: Explore complex health concerns in depth and develop a plan to overcome them.
settings.text_2: Address a specific health concern with help from our medical herbalists.
settings.text_3: Learn how to improve your nutrition to meet your health and wellness goals.

settings.title: Testimonials
settings.intro_text: This is what our customers are saying about us.

settings.title: Related Blog Posts
settings.sub_title: Blog posts about our health tinctures, capsules and more.

settings.title: Related Blog Posts
settings.sub_title: Blog posts about our health tinctures, capsules and more.

settings.title: Yoga, Breathwork & Meditation
settings.text: These three, when practised together, produce the art of calm. Something we could all do with from time to time.

settings.title: Yoga, breathwork and mediation are tools to help you navigate the modern world
settings.text:
Many of us are accustomed to living in a heightened state of stress and anxiety. This can lead to long term health problems.

Yoga, breathwork and meditation are effective techniques to help you cope with whatever life has in store.

settings.title: The benefits of yoga, breathwork & meditation are time-tested and scientifically proven
settings.text:
When practised in conjunction with each other, they instil a sense of calm, protect against the physical and emotional impact of stress, and bring clarity when you need it most.

Best of all, they give you the opportunity to learn to love yourself.

settings.title: Why you should learn with Zen Maitri
settings.text:
We offer a range of group drop-in classes and courses that introduce you to life altering techniques and target specific areas of your wellbeing, from improving sleep to managing stress.

Explore techniques that you can easily integrate into your everyday.

settings.title: About Zen Maitri
settings.text: Below are some common questions we're asked about who we are and what we do. For more depth you can head on over to our Vision page.

settings.title: What does 'Zen Maitri' mean?
settings.text: We have taken the ancient meaning of “Zen Maitri” which translates to “Loving Kindness” and have sought to understand its application to the current world in which we live. Loving Kindness today means using all of the modern resources available to us to take care of ourselves and other beings. In terms of natural health, Zen Maitri is harnessing the power gifted to us by nature in herbal remedies (physiological healing), food/nutrition and meditation (mental healing work) so that we all become healthier, stronger, fitter, kinder, positive, energised and more loving.

settings.title: What does Zen Maitri specialise in?
settings.text: Zen Maitri is renowned for its herbal remedies targeting a broad spectrum of conditions and its expert-driven health consultations that empower clients to take control of their own health and wellbeing.

settings.title: Where is Zen Maitri?
settings.text:
Our store is located in Chiswick, West London, right in the centre of our beautiful buzzing community of Turnham Green Terrace. We have been told that it is a haven amidst London’s hustle and bustle and we would love to see you there so do pop by!

You can contact us here.

settings.title: Where do you ship to?
settings.text: We ship to the UK, Europe, the United States, and most countries around the world. Please contact us to check if you are unsure.

settings.title: Where does Zen Maitri source its herbs?
settings.text: The majority of our herbs are sourced from Europe, from the best organic and sustainable farms. Some herbs, that only grow in certain conditions, are sourced from further afield, such as the Americas or Asia.

settings.title: Does Zen Maitri offer consultations?
settings.text: Yes, we offer three types of consultations for clients: (1) The Natural Health Consultation, which is a comprehensive dive into your health and wellbeing needs with one of our Medical Herbalists (2) The Express Health Consultation is a shorter version of the Natural Health Consultation and is ideal if you are a short on time and you have a less complex health condition (3) Nutrition Consultation gives you the chance to learn how to improve your nutrition to meet your health and wellbeing goals with our expert Nutritionist and Dietician.

settings.title: Do you offer herbal teas for specific health concerns?
settings.text: Yes we do! Please see our herbal tea collection or contact us for more information on your specific requirements.

settings.title: Do you need a consultation to get a personalised herbal prescription?
settings.text: Not for every case. Some simple or short term complaints/conditions may have simple solutions. But it is recommended you have a consultation in order to find the most appropriate prescription for you. Often there are underlying conditions or connected ailments which may not be apparent to the patient but would be to a Medical Herbalist and so consultations are important in understanding the big picture of a person’s overall health and wellbeing.

settings.title: Do you make your own herbal tea?
settings.text: Yes, we blend our teas in-house using original recipes in the apothecary. Our teas are packed with only the best herbs and plants and are carefully made in small batches by our team of Medical Herbalists.

settings.title: Does Zen Maitri offer nutrition advice?
settings.text: Yes, you can freely consult our Medical Herbalists at any time for nutritional advice. But if you want an in-depth assessment of your nutrition needs, then we recommend you doing a Nutrition Consultation with our Nutritionist and Dietician.

settings.title: Does Zen Maitri offer personalised herbal products?
settings.text: Yes we do! We specialise in making natural products just for your individual health needs. Personalised products are usually made after you have done a consultation with us so please get in touch to book one. We are also always happy and available to have a quick chat so do connect with us.

settings.title: Are herbal supplements safe to take?
settings.text: Absolutely - our Medical Herbalists, who make up our supplements, are fully qualified and between them have over half a century of experience. We also ensure that we use the highest quality, organic, minimally processed and safest plants and herbs in our supplements. Where necessary, we provide warnings when certain herbal supplements can't be taken alongside conventional medications.

settings.title: Does Zen Maitri offer corporate wellbeing services?
settings.text: Yes we do. We believe that mindfulness, meditation, and nutrition are essential for happy and productive people. You can find out more here.

settings.title: What are herbal remedies?
settings.text:
Herbal remedies were the main source of medicine available in the UK up until as recently as the 1930s, and 25% of modern pharmaceutical medicines available today were originally discovered and derived from plants.

Modern scientific research has demonstrated the effectiveness of many plants for a wide range of ailments and there is considerable and growing scientific evidence and research on the benefits and effectiveness of specific herbal remedies.

settings.title: What are medicinal herbs?
settings.text: The process of making plant remedies occurs through minimal processing to preserve the active constituents of the plant. This processing usually includes drying fresh herbs, cutting them into a tea or grinding them into powder. Liquid herbal remedies known as herbal tinctures are made by soaking the dried or fresh herbs in alcohol for extraction and preservation.

settings.title: How do herbs have health benefits?
settings.text: They work in a similar way to conventional medicine by having an effect on cell signalling, such as hormones, neurotransmitters and enzymes and other processes and functions. The difference with herbal remedies is that their action focuses on bringing the body back into balance (an individual's set point) which is also called homeostasis. An example of this is Hawthorn normalising blood pressure and Meadowsweet normalising stomach acid levels.

settings.title: What conditions can herbs help with?
settings.text: Almost all conditions can be supported with herbal remedies and they can be used preventatively as well as for active conditions. For the best outcome, it is advisable to have a consultation with a Medical Herbalist to obtain the most appropriate and bespoke herbs for you and your condition(s).

settings.title: Do herbs actually work?
settings.text:
Herbal remedies have been used for thousands of years across the globe, spanning a multitude of cultures and hemispheres. There is a growing body of evidence and research on the effectiveness of using herbs and plants to help relieve conditions.

For example, some herbs, such as andrographis, which has proved to be effective at fighting respiratory infections, is currently being trialed by the NHS to explore whether it should be prescribed, in some cases, instead of antibiotics.

settings.title: Are herbal medicines safe?
settings.text: The herbal products prescribed by a qualified Medical Herbalist are always safe. Natural does not always mean safe but a Medical Herbalist will always ensure a safe form is given and is appropriate for the individual person and their particular needs, including giving consideration to any other medicines a patient is already taking, whether prescription medicines or otherwise.

settings.title: Should I check with my Dr before taking herbal prescriptions?
settings.text: It is always advisable to consult your doctor before taking herbs if you are taking prescription medicine or have a serious, long-standing or complicated condition. Medical herbalists will, however,  always ensure that the herbs you take are safe and appropriate.

settings.title: Do I have to stop taking my medication when starting a herbal prescription?
settings.text: No. We would strongly advise that you always check with your doctor first before you stop any medication.  Our Medical Herbalists will be able to advise you on any potential interaction between medication and herbs but they will always recommend you speak to your doctor before you stop taking any medication.

settings.title: Are herbal medicines suitable for children and the elderly?
settings.text: Yes, but doses will differ and certain herbs will not be appropriate. Have a chat with our team to ensure the most suitable herbs are chosen.

settings.title: Can I take herbs while pregnant?
settings.text: Yes, but only certain herbs are safe and Medical Herbalists prefer not to give herbs in the first trimester unless under exceptional circumstances. The small doses of usual food herbs found in cooking are appropriate. Please contact us to discuss your specific needs.

settings.title: Do herbal medicines have side effects?
settings.text: Generally herbal remedies have very few side effects when taken appropriately. The majority of side effects reported include mild headache and some digestive discomfort but this is usually rectified by lowering the dose or using a different herb to achieve the same outcome.

settings.title: What are the strongest natural antibiotics?
settings.text: Herbalists don’t tend to view herbs as equivalent to antibiotics. Strong antimicrobial herbs include Goldenseal Root, Barberry Root, Echinacea Root and Elderberry. The benefits of herbal antimicrobials are that the beneficial gut flora is usually not changed after taking herbal remedies.

settings.title: OUR PHILOSOPHY
settings.text: Everything we do at Zen Maitri  starts with a simple goal: To help you take control of your health using products and approaches inspired by the natural world.

settings.title: So What Do We Mean by ‘Taking Control’?
settings.main_text:
First, it’s about listening to expert advice to better understand the needs of your body and mind. Then you have to understand those needs in relation to your lifestyle. After that, it’s about taking small steps in the right direction, towards the life you want to live. 

The needs of your body and mind are determined by the demands of your lifestyle. So it makes sense that being ‘healthy’ is in many ways unique to each person. A young professional athlete will have different health goals to a middle-aged accountant, for example. 

The process of taking control of your health is not a one-off event. Becoming and feeling healthy is a process, a journey you can initiate and pursue at any time. 

At Zen Maitri, natural health encompasses this journey of empowerment. It’s never too late to get started and it never really ends, precisely because life is always subject to change.

settings.title: The Three Constituents of Natural Health
settings.main_text:
Our approach to natural health is made up of three elements, which sit at the foundation of our products and services:
 
Herbalism
 
Meditation
 
Nutrition
 
Although they can be enjoyed and provide benefits independently, we believe these elements are best when applied together. There are feedback loops between all of them: the benefits of herbalism can potentially be enhanced through meditation or having access to good nutritional advice, and vice versa. 
 
All of which explains why we’re committed to an integrative approach to natural health.

settings.title: Creating Access to Expert Knowledge
settings.main_text:
It’s hard to pursue a natural health journey without expert advice. Our experts - medical herbalists, meditation practitioners, nutritionists - are here to help you make informed decisions about your needs and goals. 

We provide clients with the right knowledge and information. Knowledge is key: people cannot become healthy unless they have access to information about what their body and mind requires. 

Access to herbs, good nutrition and meditation to support the mind and body. We equip you with the appropriate products and services to help you reach your goals. Emotional care and wellbeing. Even taking small steps in the right direction can be challenging. Our team is on hand to support you along the way.

settings.title: Natural Health is Your Own Journey
settings.main_text: There is no one size fits all approach to health because every person’s journey is unique. That’s why we take the time to listen to you, understand your lifestyle, needs, and goals and use this to provide expertise on the best next steps.  You determine your natural health journey. You lead the way. We are here to guide you through the process.

settings.text: We are an urban retreat where you can take a breath and take the time to speak and be heard. Everyone is welcome to step inside and get advice from a medical herbalist.

settings.title: Herbal Apothecary
settings.text: Inside you’ll be greeted by a beautiful herbal apothecary, where more than 150 herbs are housed in a mix of loose form, powders, and tinctures.

settings.title: Natural Products
settings.text: You’ll also find a wide range of natural products developed to support sleep, focus, immunity, digestion, hormonal balances, and much more.

settings.title: Design
settings.text: Our design is inspired by Dutch minimalism and the natural beauty of Bali. Both combine to form an urban sanctuary that offers calm amongst the commotion.

settings.title: Our Vision
settings.text: We offer a range of scientifically-backed natural products, meditation experiences, and comprehensive health consultations to empower your wellbeing journey, one step at a time.

settings.title: Philosophy
settings.text: Zen means 'a state of absorbed reflection' and 'Maitri' means 'loving kindness towards all beings.' Together, Zen Maitri means to be 'totally absorbed by loving kindness towards all beings.' Being kind towards others is only possible through being kind to oneself, which concretely means taking control of one's own health and wellbeing.

settings.title: Principles
settings.text: Evidence-driven, sustainable, personalised health. Accessible to all.

settings.title: Products
settings.text: Herbal teas, tinctures, and smoothie powders, developed by our team of herbalists to address your health concerns.

settings.text: Our Turnham Green Terrace store is a serene escape that’s open to all. Speak with our team, explore collections inspired by nature, and start taking control of your wellbeing.

settings.title: Health Consultations
settings.text: Take control of your health.

settings.title: You talk. We listen
settings.text:
A Zen Maitri Natural Health Consultation gives you the opportunity to explore your health concerns with a Medical Herbalist, who can tailor a prescription to meet your goals.

The expert knowledge provided by our team will empower you to make positive changes to your lifestyle. It's a new start, a new approach, and you lead the way.

settings.title: What does a consultation involve?
settings.text:
You can explore our consultations in detail by hitting one of the buttons below. But our standard consultation format looks like this:

  • An appointment with a Medical Herbalist to find out more about you, and to assess your physical and mental needs
  • Research and formulation of your bespoke natural prescription
  • A check-in to see how things are going with your prescription

settings.title: Why you should have a consultation with Zen Maitri
settings.text: We do things differently...

settings.title: The expertise of our team
settings.text: Zen Maitri has a team of kind and experienced medical herbalists. Our consulting medical herbalists are fully qualified, members of the National Institute of Medical Herbalists, and receive support and supervision from our Lead Medical Herbalist, Sara Hennessy.

settings.title: Harnessing the power of nature
settings.text:
Herbal medicine is the use of plants to promote healing, to relieve suffering, to promote wellbeing and encourage positive health outcomes. It combines up-to-date scientific advances in the study of physiology with a deep knowledge about medicinal plants, in order to help the dynamic ecosystem of the body to restore and balance its function. Plants contain an array of beneficial compounds that act independently but often also synergistically to produce effects greater than the sum of their parts. 

Herbal medicine harnesses the power of whole plant medicines to support the fundamental functions of the body and allow restoration of health.

settings.title: A holistic, personalised approach
settings.text: In herbal medicine, we often say that we aim to “treat the patient rather than the disease”. It’s a customised approach that consists in the targeted, individualised application of appropriate herbal medicines to patients to address any health concerns and promote wellbeing. We consider that it is key to thoroughly understand the background to a person’s condition before formulating treatment. That’s how we reach the best possible outcomes. All of which means our treatments are often directed at the potentially multifactorial causes of the condition, not just the condition itself.

settings.title: Book A Consultation
settings.text_2: Explore complex health concerns in depth and develop a plan to overcome them.
settings.text_3: Address a specific health concern with help from our medical herbalists.
settings.text_4: Learn how to improve your nutrition to meet your health and wellness goals.

settings.title: Need a Repeat Prescription?
settings.text: Fill in the form below and one of our Medical Herbalsits will be in touch with you within 24 hours.

settings.title: Testimonials
settings.intro_text: This is what our customers are saying about us.

settings.title: Yoga, Breathwork & Meditation
settings.text: These three, when practised together, produce the art of calm. Something we could all do with from time to time. Take a look at our current classes and courses below.

settings.title: Moving, Breathing & Meditating for Health & Wellbeing
settings.text: Discover our new weekly class.

settings.title: Yoga, breathwork and meditation are tools to help you navigate the modern world
settings.text: Many of us are accustomed to living in a heightened state of stress and anxiety. This can lead to long term health problems.

settings.title: The benefits of yoga, breathwork and meditation are time-tested and scientifically proven
settings.text: When these three are practised in conjunction with each other, they instil a sense of calm, protect against the physical and emotional impact of stress, and bring clarity when you need it most.

settings.title: Why you should learn with Zen Maitri
settings.text:
We offer a range of group drop-in classes and courses that introduce you to life altering techniques and target specific areas of your wellbeing, from improving sleep to managing stress.

Explore techniques that you can easily integrate into your everyday.

settings.title: Testimonials
settings.intro_text: Don't take our word for it...

settings.title: Our Principles
settings.text: Our principles define who we are and who we will always strive to be.

settings.title: Excellence
settings.main_text: We strive towards excellence in all we do. All our medical herbalists have degrees in herbal medicine and we only work with people who have accreditation in their field of expertise.

settings.title: Accessibility
settings.main_text: We are driven to share the knowledge and science of natural health. We have created a store where anyone can enter to consult and seek advice. We also publish regular articles focused on topics across our areas of expertise.

settings.title: Inclusivity
settings.main_text: We provide a non-judgemental, safe, and inclusive space for all of our clients. Everyone is welcome.

settings.title: Personalisation
settings.main_text: You and your needs are at the heart of everything we do. We can tailor every one of our products and services to you. There is no one size fits all approach to health.

settings.title: Integration
settings.main_text: If something is to support your health, it should integrate into the life you have chosen to lead. On the whole, healthy habits should be things that are easy to live around.

settings.title: Sustainability
settings.main_text: We are committed to fighting climate change and protecting nature in all its diversity, which includes the people whose livelihoods directly depend upon it. All of our packaging apart from our lids is 100% recyclable. We are working on finding an alternative to plastic lids.

settings.title: Gradualism
settings.main_text: Small steps can lead to big leaps. Becoming and feeling healthy should not involve going from one extreme to another. We believe that small changes and the cultivation of new habits will, over time, lead to the greatest rewards.

settings.title: Our Products
settings.text: Inspired by nature. Blended by experts.

settings.title: Bespoke to You
settings.text: We make herbal products to order and tailored to your needs after doing a health consultation with one of our Medical Herbalists. These include teas, powders, and tinctures.

settings.title: 100% Natural
settings.text: Everything our team makes is all-natural, with zero synthetic additives.

settings.title: Ready to Go
settings.text: We also have ranges of ready-made products that have been developed by our team of Medical Herbalists to support specific areas of health and wellbeing.

settings.title: Health
settings.text: The Zen Maitri Health range features supplements and tinctures. Each has been developed for a specific purpose: to strengthen immunity, aid digestion, detox, energise, relieve stress and help you have a peaceful night’s sleep.

settings.title: Herbal Tea
settings.text: The Zen Maitri Herbal Tea range has been developed with one thing in mind: to taste great while bringing health benefits from nature into your home. These aromatic fusions include Rose and Hibiscus, Jasmine and Lemongrass, and Nettle and Fennel. There’s also a tea for each focus of the Zen Maitri Health Range, which can be enjoyed alongside our supplements and tinctures.

settings.title: Spa
settings.text: The Zen Maitri Spa range is all about relaxation. It features hair and massage oils, essential oils, revitalising day and night creams, and floral waters. These products have been designed to pamper, to awaken your senses and - above all - to help you care for yourself.

How would like you to do the consultation?

settings.note: I understand that the advice/treatments given and herbal remedies/supplements prescribed are not involved with the direct treatment of any disease and is not a substitute for medical diagnosis or treatment. I understand that herbal remedies/treatments/supplements should not be taken under certain medical conditions. I confirm that I have stated all my known medical conditions and answered all questions honestly. I agree to keep the practitioner informed of any changes in my medical profile during my consultations/treatments and understand that there shall be no liability on the Practitioner’s part should I fail to do so. If I experience any pain, discomfort or change in symptoms, I will immediately inform the Practitioner. I explicitly give my full consent to a physical examination should the Practitioner deem it necessary. If I feel any discomfort I will immediately report to the Practitioner. Neither Zen Maitri nor any herbalist/practitioner/nutritionist can be held responsible for any adverse reactions to the recommendations. The use of any herb or derivative is entirely at your own risk. I am aware that any herbal remedies, supplements and treatments prescribed do not guarantee to cure specific medical conditions. I acknowledge that any side effects of treatments or supplements are not the responsibility of the Practitioner and I declare it's my sole decision to accept and take the herbal remedies, supplements and treatments. I have read the Zen Maitri Privacy Policy Page (www.zenmaitri.com/privacy) and give consent to the management of my data provided. I consent for Zen Maitri to use my contact information provided to send appointment reminders or contact me regarding my appointment via phone, email or SMS.I consent for Zen Maitri to use my email address to send treatment information/procedures following the appointment.

settings.heading: Pre-Consultation Form
settings.note: Please provide as much detail ahead of your consultation with the Zen Maitri team.

settings.title: Corporate Wellbeing
settings.text: Empower your team with mindfulness, health insights, and transformative coaching.

settings.title: Three Ways to Transform Your Workplace
settings.text_1: Explore aspects of health and wellbeing with presentations delivered by our knowledgeable team.
settings.text_2: Turn your office into an oasis. Treat your team to a one-off or regular meditation practice.
settings.text_3: Powerful, interactive coaching sessions that inspire, support and sustain positive mental habits.

settings.title: Workplace Zen
settings.text:
What would it mean to feel more joy and happiness? To respond rather than react. To not feel overwhelmed by stress and anxiety.

The ability to experience life more fully and step back from limiting thoughts are just some of the benefits of practicing mindfulness.

In a corporate context, these scientifically-proven tools can help your team take charge of the day, regain their balance, and manage emotions more effectively.

Kate Greenslade’s approach blends ancient mindfulness techniques with the latest neuroscience. The result is transformational coaching that helps teams develop resilience and coping strategies for future challenges, uncertainty, change, and stress.

Workplace Zen explores these topics with engaging sessions, deep introspectives, and practical exercises that provide actionable insights into management styles, motivation, communication, and teambuilding.

Choose from a deep dive into one of our three modules or cover each of them as part of a single package

Current workshops include:

- Self Awareness: The first step to choice.

- You are not your thoughts: How to manage overthinking and distraction.

- The proven power of gratitude: Increase your happiness and joy.

settings.title: Meditation Experiences
settings.text:
Incorporating meditative practices into the working day can relieve stress and enhance clarity.

For your team to benefit from the wide benefits of meditation and mindfulness, we recommend regular sessions. But you can start with a single experience to test the water.

settings.title: Health Presentations
settings.text: Our expert-led presentations empower your employees to live better. We can tailor the focus to suit your needs or provide one of our time-tested talks on immunity, metabolism, or herbal first aid.
